Demography

class Demography

Bases: ABC

Base class for demographic scenarios.

n_epochs: Optional[int]

Number of epochs.

n_pops: int

Number of populations / demes.

pop_names: List[str]

Population names.

__init__()

Initialize the demography.

logger

The logger instance

plot_pop_sizes(show: bool = True, file: Optional[str] = None, t_max: float = 10, max_epochs: int = 100, title: str = 'Population size trajectory', ax: Optional[matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes] = None)

Plot the population size over time.

Parameters:

  • show (bool) – Whether to show the plot.

  • file (Optional[str]) – File to save the plot to.

  • title (str) – Title of the plot.

  • t_max (float) – Maximum time to plot.

  • max_epochs (int) – Maximum number of epochs to plot.

  • title – Title of the plot.

  • ax (Optional[Axes]) – Axes object to plot to.

Return type:

Axes

Returns:

Axes object.

Exponential growth trajectory.

Parameters:

  • growth_rate (Union[float, ndarray, Dict[Any, float]]) – Exponential growth rate. A single value, a numpy array or a dictionary mapping keys to values.

msprime demographic model.

class PiecewiseConstantDemography(pop_sizes: Union[Dict[str, Dict[float, float]], List[Dict[float, float]], Dict[float, float]] = [{0: 1}], migration_rates: Optional[Union[Dict[Tuple[str, str], Dict[float, float]], Dict[float, numpy.ndarray]]] = None)

Bases: Demography

Piecewise constant demographic scenario.

__init__(pop_sizes: Union[Dict[str, Dict[float, float]], List[Dict[float, float]], Dict[float, float]] = [{0: 1}], migration_rates: Optional[Union[Dict[Tuple[str, str], Dict[float, float]], Dict[float, numpy.ndarray]]] = None)

Create a piecewise time-homogeneous demographic scenario.

Parameters:

  • pop_sizes (Union[Dict[str, Dict[float, float]], List[Dict[float, float]], Dict[float, float]]) – Population sizes. Either a dictionary of the form {pop_i: {time1: size1, time2: size2}}, indexed by population name, or a list of dictionaries of the form {time1: size1, time2: size2} ordered by population index, or a single dictionary of the form {time1: size1, time2: size2} for a single population. Note that the first time must always be 0, and that population sizes must always be positive.

  • migration_rates (Union[Dict[Tuple[str, str], Dict[float, float]], Dict[float, ndarray], None]) – Migration matrix. Use None for no migration. A dictionary of the form {(pop_i, pop_j): {time1: rate1, time2: rate2}} where m_ij is the migration rate (backward in time) from population pop_i to population pop_j at time time1 etc. Alternatively, a dictionary of 2-dimensional numpy arrays where the rows correspond to the source population and the columns to the destination. Note that migration rates for which the source and destination population are the same are ignored and that the first time must always be 0.

pop_names: List[str]

Population names.

n_pops: int

Number of populations / demes.

n_epochs: Optional[int]

Number of epochs.

to_msprime(max_epochs: int = 1000)

Convert to an msprime demography object.

Parameters:

max_epochs (int) – Maximum number of epochs to use. This is necessary when the number of epochs is infinite.

Return type:

msprime.Demography

Returns:

msprime demography object.

class ConstantDemography(pop_sizes: Union[float, Dict[str, float], List[float]] = 1, migration_rates: Optional[Union[Dict[Tuple[str, str], float], numpy.ndarray]] = None)

Bases: PiecewiseConstantDemography

Demographic scenario that is constant over time.

__init__(pop_sizes: Union[float, Dict[str, float], List[float]] = 1, migration_rates: Optional[Union[Dict[Tuple[str, str], float], numpy.ndarray]] = None)

Create a time-homogeneous demographic scenario.

Parameters:

  • pop_sizes (Union[float, Dict[str, float], List[float]]) – A single population size if there is only one population, or a list of population sizes for various populations, or a dictionary mapping population names to population sizes like {'pop_0': 1, 'pop_1': 2}.

  • migration_rates (Union[Dict[Tuple[str, str], float], ndarray, None]) – Migration rates. Use None for no migration. Either a dictionary of the form {(pop_i, pop_j): m_ij} where m_ij is the migration rate from population pop_i to population pop_j backward in time or a 2-dimensional numpy array where the rows correspond to the source population and the columns to the destination. Note that migration rates for which the source and destination population are the same are ignored.

static exponential_growth(x0: Union[float, numpy.ndarray, Dict[Any, float]], growth_rate: Union[float, numpy.ndarray, Dict[Any, float]])

Exponential growth trajectory.

Parameters:

  • x0 (Union[float, ndarray, Dict[Any, float]]) – Initial rate. A single value, a numpy array or a dictionary mapping keys to values.

  • growth_rate (Union[float, ndarray, Dict[Any, float]]) – Exponential growth rate. A single value, a numpy array or a dictionary mapping keys to values.

Return type:

Callable[[float], Union[float, ndarray, Dict[Any, float]]]

Returns:

Function that returns the rates at a given time.

class DiscretizedDemography(pop_sizes: Callable[[float], Dict[str, float]], migration_rates: Optional[Callable[[float], Dict[Tuple[str, str], float]]] = None, min_size: float = 0.001, start_size: float = 1, max_growth: float = 1)

Bases: PiecewiseConstantDemography

Discretized demographic scenario.

__init__(pop_sizes: Callable[[float], Dict[str, float]], migration_rates: Optional[Callable[[float], Dict[Tuple[str, str], float]]] = None, min_size: float = 0.001, start_size: float = 1, max_growth: float = 1)

Create a continuous demographic scenario. By default, the discretization intervals are determined dynamically based on the increase/decrease in the population size / migration rates. Set min_size equal to start_size to have a fixed discretization interval.

Parameters:

  • pop_sizes (Callable[[float], Dict[str, float]]) – Function that returns the population size at a given time. A dictionary of population sizes at time t indexed by population name.

  • migration_rates (Optional[Callable[[float], Dict[Tuple[str, str], float]]]) – Function that returns a dictionary of the form {(pop_i, pop_j): m_ij} given time t, where m_ij is the migration rate from population pop_i to population pop_j.

  • min_size (float) – Minimum discretization interval size.

  • start_size (float) – Interval size at the start of new epochs.

  • max_growth (float) – Maximum absolute growth rate compared to the previous population size.

min_size: float

Minimum discretization interval

start_size: float

Step size at the start of new epochs

max_growth: float

Maximum absolute growth rate compared to the previous population size

pop_names: List[str]

Population names

n_pops: int

Number of populations / demes

n_epochs: Optional[int]

Number of epochs

property times: Iterator[float]

Get the times at which the population sizes change.

Returns:

Times.

property pop_sizes: Dict[str, Iterator[float]]

Get the population sizes.

Returns:

Population sizes.

property migration_rates: Dict[Tuple[str, str], Iterator[float]]

Get the migration rates.

Returns:

Migration rates.
